actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

official_title: A bill to extend the deadline for compliance with certain drinking water regulations, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Directs the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to extend for one year the deadline for small- and medium- size water systems that serve 10,000 or fewer customers to comply with the Safe Drinking Water Act with respect to: (1) the national primary drinking water regulations for lead and copper; (2) phase II drinking water regulations for 26 synthetic organic chemicals and seven inorganic chemicals; and (3) phase V drinking water regulations for 18 synthetic organic chemicals and five inorganic chemicals. Requires the Administrator, with respect to such regulations, to conduct sufficient research and report to the Congress on: (1) the degree of health risks from non-compliance by small- and medium-size water systems; (2) the economic cost of compliance for the systems; and (3) other impacts on the systems.

titles.title: A bill to extend the deadline for compliance with certain drinking water regulations, and for other purposes.
